intro: Sonchus tingitanus, commonly known as the Spanish dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lanceolate leaves with serrated edges. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, which develop into fluffy seeds with pappus for wind dispersal. Sonchus tingitanus is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some areas.
